column4: meh, I'm still getting operation not permitted when trying to run 'modprobe ndiswrapper'.. would it make any sense if root didn't have access to /lib/modules/?
root has access to everything
That's what I thought too.. In other words there's something else wrong and I'm just bad at interprating the Error-message
wheres the drivers stored for ndiswrapper?
you mean the one I'm trying to get working? I don't know actually, any way to check?
erm, no, I dont know, didnt you copy the driver to somewhere?
you mean the windows-driver?
yes
ah, I just put it in /lib/, didn't know of any better place to put it
did you follow some sort of howto?
yeah, "HowToSetUpNdiswrapper" from the ubuntu-wiki
well, if its in the right spot, go over it all again, and double check.
no, I'm still getting the same error =/
now ndiswrapper is claiming that the driver is invalid though, so I'm guessing this is pretty much as far as I can go if it doesn't work with the windows-driver
anyways, thanks for the help
got the right file? for the driver, theres two, and one doesnt work
the right file? I'm supposed to use the windowsdriver from the manufacturor ain't I?
yes but there is two files generally I think. I havent actualyy used ndiwrapper, but read there is generally two files.
okay, no I was supplied with only one .inf file
ok, if my memory serves me right, thats the right one.
is there any chance that perhaps an older driver might work better?
sorry dude, absolutely no idea.
aff, then I'll have to go back to getting the 'native' driver working. Thanks for the help though!
